title: Error retrieving matching logs
body: From a canary node... ``` {"@timestamp":"2023-06-13T22:30:12,501","level":"ERROR","thread":"vert.x-worker-thread-12","class":"BaseJsonRpcProcessor","message":"Error processing method: eth_getLogs [{"address":["0x00000000219ab540356cbb839cbe05303d7705fa"],"fromBlock":"0xaaa98c","toBlock":"0xaaad74","topics":null}]","throwable":" java.lang.IllegalStateException: Error retrieving matching logs at org.hyperledger.besu.ethereum.api.query.BlockchainQueries.matchingLogs(BlockchainQueries.java:710) at org.hyperledger.besu.ethereum.api.jsonrpc.internal.methods.EthGetLogs.lambda$response$3(EthGetLogs.java:98) at java.base/java.util.Optional.orElseGet(Optional.java:364) at org.hyperledger.besu.ethereum.api.jsonrpc.internal.methods.EthGetLogs.response(EthGetLogs.java:70) at org.hyperledger.besu.ethereum.api.jsonrpc.execution.BaseJsonRpcProcessor.process(BaseJsonRpcProcessor.java:44) at org.hyperledger.besu.ethereum.api.jsonrpc.execution.TracedJsonRpcProcessor.process(TracedJsonRpcProcessor.java:41) at org.hyperledger.besu.ethereum.api.jsonrpc.execution.TimedJsonRpcProcessor.process(TimedJsonRpcProcessor.java:45) at org.hyperledger.besu.ethereum.api.jsonrpc.execution.AuthenticatedJsonRpcProcessor.process(AuthenticatedJsonRpcProcessor.java:51) at org.hyperledger.besu.ethereum.api.jsonrpc.execution.JsonRpcExecutor.execute(JsonRpcExecutor.java:92) at org.hyperledger.besu.ethereum.api.handlers.AbstractJsonRpcExecutor.executeRequest(AbstractJsonRpcExecutor.java:87) at org.hyperledger.besu.ethereum.api.handlers.JsonRpcObjectExecutor.execute(JsonRpcObjectExecutor.java:57) at org.hyperledger.besu.ethereum.api.handlers.JsonRpcExecutorHandler.lambda$handler$0(JsonRpcExecutorHandler.java:57) at java.base/java.util.Optional.ifPresentOrElse(Optional.java:196) at org.hyperledger.besu.ethereum.api.handlers.JsonRpcExecutorHandler.lambda$handler$2(JsonRpcExecutorHandler.java:54) at io.vertx.ext.web.impl.BlockingHandlerDecorator.lambda$handle$0(BlockingHandlerDecorator.java:48) at io.vertx.core.impl.ContextBase.lambda$null$0(ContextBase.java:137) at io.vertx.core.impl.ContextInternal.dispatch(ContextInternal.java:264) at io.vertx.core.impl.ContextBase.lambda$executeBlocking$1(ContextBase.java:135) at java.base/java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1136) at java.base/java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:635) at io.netty.util.concurrent.FastThreadLocalRunnable.run(FastThreadLocalRunnable.java:30) at java.base/java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:833)\nCaused by: java.lang.RuntimeException: java.util.NoSuchElementException: No value present at org.hyperledger.besu.ethereum.api.query.BlockchainQueries.lambda$matchingLogs$17(BlockchainQueries.java:696) at java.base/java.util.Optional.map(Optional.java:260) at org.hyperledger.besu.ethereum.api.query.BlockchainQueries.matchingLogs(BlockchainQueries.java:685)\n\t... 21 more\nCaused by: java.util.NoSuchElementException: No value present at java.base/java.util.Optional.orElseThrow(Optional.java:377) at org.hyperledger.besu.ethereum.api.query.BlockchainQueries.matchingLogsCached(BlockchainQueries.java:759) at org.hyperledger.besu.ethereum.api.query.BlockchainQueries.lambda$matchingLogs$17(BlockchainQueries.java:688)\n\t... 23 more\n"} ``` Looks like we don't have a certain block number in the chain... https://github.com/hyperledger/besu/blob/main/ethereum/api/src/main/java/org/hyperledger/besu/ethereum/api/query/BlockchainQueries.java#L759 The symptom is that prysm-besu is struggling to stay in sync... and we get this prysm log... ``` time="2023-06-14 05:10:28" level=error msg="Unable to process past deposit contract logs, perhaps your execution client is not fully synced" error="processPastLogs: Internal error" prefix=powchain ``` This started happening at the end of a long backwards sync, following a Tuweni regression on main that caused the node to fall behind by ~2 days. ``` #################################################################################################### # # # Besu version 23.4.2-dev-180c7519 # # # # Configuration: # # Network: Mainnet # # Network Id: 1 # # Data storage: Bonsai # # Sync mode: Snap # # RPC HTTP APIs: TRACE,ADMIN,DEBUG,NET,ETH,WEB3,TXPOOL # # RPC HTTP port: 8545 # # Engine APIs: ENGINE,ETH # # Engine port: 8551 # # Engine JWT: /etc/jwt-secret.hex # # # # Host: # # Java: openjdk-java-17 # # Maximum heap size: 4.00 GB # # OS: linux-x86_64 # # glibc: 2.35 # # Total memory: 15.28 GB # # CPU cores: 4 # # # #################################################################################################### ``` Prysm version: "Prysm/v4.0.5/aa7d0df7ff5f74168bdaf93453c856f279ec1573. Built at: 2023-05-22 18:03:46+00:00"
Will try deleting the caches and restarting besu just in case

> Will try deleting the caches and restarting besu just in case

No error in besu yet, but now prysm has a slightly different one...
```
time="2023-06-14 05:51:23" level=error msg="Unable to process past deposit contract logs, perhaps your execution client is not fully synced" error="processPastLogs: Could not process deposit log: received incorrect merkle index: wanted 0 but got 568326" prefix=powchain
```

Maybe it will change again once besu caches are rebuilt
Non-issue. This was caused by this node being previously resynced using `--Xcheckpoint-post-merge-enabled` so it was missing the logs, and only started complaining after some other things went wrong!
